reviews.review_msg: he's so nice and tbh even if you don't go to class its fine but there are pop quizzes so you should probably go to class just incase. if you do the readings beforehand you won't have any problems understanding the lectures, assignments weren't hard or graded hard either.

Show up to lectures and tutorials!! He gives lots of helpful tips and even hints on what he expects from assignments and essays. His grading is tough but fair, and if you listen to feedback it really helps you do better on later assignments. Lectures are fun, engaging, and I really liked the readings he assigned. He is a very knowledgeable prof.
He was pretty funny but his phrasing and vocabulary are sometimes too sophisticated to understand. His lectures were too fast-paced for me but he wasn't terrible at all

niall is amazing!! this prof was one of the most sweetest and most knowledgeable people ever! I found his lectures + readings chosen super interesting and insightful. Quizzes were a bit tricky (required very thorough readings) but essays, midterm, and projects were very straightforward. make sure to speak up during class for participation points

Had him for Summer 2024, and he was a great professor! The class was very interesting and what made it better was his vast knowledge on history as well as his sense of humour, I personally loved it. It was a chill semester with couple group assignments but very short, and there are pop quizzes but those are not too hard if you've done the readings!
Just kind of boring and basic, maybe was just class content.

one of the most helpful profs at sfu. Will always any questions you have and be willing to help you out without hesitation. This class (Berlin) was challenging for me but prof Niall made it easy and enjoyable. Quizzes are a bit difficult but there are many other chances to redeem yourself.
Niall for the most part was good, the grading for a few of the assignments was oddly specific and favored quantity over quality but all round good.

-The assignments were ok, but the lectures were incredibly dry and useless. ( everything was based on readings/films) -He promised to make a ppt for midterm review, but did not make it. ( also he assigned the midterm one week before finals) -The course felt disorganized & he was very unapproachable. Im super happy that its over now.

Like others have said, the lectures can be quite boring so I wouldn't recommend this course to someone who doesn't have an interest in medieval lit, but if you're already interested in the material than you should have no problem as he is very passionate. His grading is fair but definitely get your essay topic approved by him first.

For a non-hum student, the course content was very intriguing. Lots of papers and readings but learned a lot. Deadlines were extended for literally every paper and class was held every other week so it was hard to keep up with the course flow. You would lose attendance marks if you skip even a single class.

Niall is passionate and knowledgeable, but he can be quite a boring lecturer. With that being said, he is a fair marker, and you can do incredibly well by simply reading all the books so you're well-equipped for the papers. He has an offbeat sense of humour that can be strange sometimes but it's more like nerdy dad energy, so you'll get used to it.
Very challenging course. I struggled through many of the concepts. He is a very tough grader. However, he does have a good sense of humour and will give you feedback when asked.

I really struggled in this class because it was an upper div HUM class and i am not a HUM major, but overall he was an ok prof. lots of reading and you pretty much had to do all the readings. His voice is a bit dry, but he would make me laugh here and here. I missed one class and it was extremely easy to meet up with him to retrieve what I needed

Overall a decent prof, not my fave but definitely not the worst either. He has a specific sense of humour that I don't really vibe with, but I can't say I didn't learn in his class. One of those profs I don't really like, but I do respect. Course content was really interesting and he was well organized.

Niall is a very nice individual, however, his lectures are painfully boring and although a lot of what he says is extremely useful for writing essays, he tends to go on and on and on and finds himself getting cut off due to the time. Pop quizzes really hit you like a truck sometimes when you have a paper due 150 pages of reading.

Niall holds his head higher than everyone and feeds off of the student-professor power difference. I would go to his office hours weekly and still found myself unable to improve even after using his criticism. He makes an intro to writing class harder than it needs to be, especially considering he is only a sessional instructor in humanities.

The lectures were fairly difficult to sit through as he sometimes trails off into odd topics, that may or may not be linked to the books you're reading. He's a pretty funny guy even if the class seems boring, I liked him until the end of the year when I got ridiculed in the tutorial which was the most embarrassing experience I've had.

NEVER NEVER NEVER. His lectures are SO DRY and he often goes off for some random facts. It's clear that he wants us to follow his ideas for the exams and papers which reduces any creativity that one may want to showcase. The books itself that he chose were so dry and hard to follow. This class seems interesting but take it with another prof.
Make sure you go to his office hour to discuss your papers before you hang them in. You will learn a lots!

Niall is funny and caring, make sure that you go to his office hours to review your papers before you hand them in. However, he tends to ramble. It takes him 20 minutes to say something that couldve been said in one sentence, which makes an already boring topic very very sleep-inducing. But, hes a fair marker and a kind guy, would take again.

An awesome prof who is very supportive (do not fear asking him for help) and nice! There were many papers but it was engaging to write them, as the assignment instructions required us to write an essay that's not a typical English paper. He'd bring in guest speakers (one of them who authored our required reading), which was cool :)
He was a really hard marker I did okay in the class but really didnt like him . save yourself dont take his classssssssss

Niall Mackenzie is the definition of boring incredibly boring. He is the pickiest marker and will penalize you for really small things and he assigns way to many papers. He makes you read allowed in class and he favourites students. Take this course is 1 . You want to bring your GPA down 2. If you like arrogant, stuck up profs.

Niall is very sarcastic and funny. He is VERY picky, but cares about how you do and tries to really help you out (so much feedback on papers!). He is super accessible via email and really nice during office hours. Hard to get an A, but if you work really hard, it's possible.

Texts that were assigned were complex, consisting of works that had enough inconsistencies that, when stacked with a full schedule of other courses, doing them was beyond anything a 400 level course should be (more graduate level). Quizzes every class that focus on the details of these texts are designed to sink your grade. A good man; poor course.

He is a extremely strict marker but if you are a generally smart person you can do fair in his class.  It is really hard to get an A in this class because he checks every little detail, and will penalize you on it.  Boring class overall and he is quite a formal guy in appearance and communication.

Niall is a different type of cat. This makes his class both entertaining and awful. Although the class was a seminar, it was basically him lecturing on random topics which don't matter. My grades on things were all over the place, but finished off with a B. Be prepared for a quiz each week about the smallest of details.

Niall is a nice guy, but drones on for much longer than is necessary. This class was a 4 hour seminar but could've daily been done in 2. Savage amount of reading. 4 textbooks that we didn't use until the 5th week of class -all the first readings were on reserve in the library in limited quantities. Class was super boring, lecture really not useful

Take the man's courses! It took me 3-4 weeks before I got used to Niall. He has his unique sense of humour that comes from all over the place. The course is demanding in terms of readings, he gives weekly quizzes just to make sure you are up to task. The grading of papers are also a bit harsh, so talk to him during office hours to get informed.
Very boring class, not a GPA booster. Really nice guy in office hours but very dull in lecture. Read the books, do your work and you'll do okay. Only take it if necessary.

If you have a genuine interest in the course topics, classes with him will be amazing. Class was at Surrey so we had no TA; he ran tutorials. Sounds like Brian from Family Guy. He`s very witty and insightful. His feedback on your papers is extremely helpful. I feel like my writing improved by  a ton just from having him as a prof. He`s brilliant.
Pretty good class. your mark really depends on the t.a. you receive not him.

5 novels, 2 of them is for essay writing and 1 of the other 3 is for the final. 1st essay novel will be most interesting. the rest are boring as hell. but I d say that TA Amelia helps improving my critical thinking and writing. she is the best and most wonderful TA i ever met and I was so lucky that she was there to help improving my literacy.

Took intro to fiction with him- good prof however lectures were sometimes dry and too full of information. Exams were straight forward and the course marks were split up in a very fair way. Would definitely not recommend taking this course if you are not prepared to read the books as the exams and papers definitely require you to have read them.

Dr. Mackenzie provided a substantial amount of insight into the books we read, revealing there is more to a book than initially thought. However, if you are not interested in reading, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Niall was very down to earth, but I felt like he was always making fun of us in his weird way! The type of prof you'd get a drink with.

Interesting course, Niall choose great books to read. However, if you are  not a avid reader and do not want to read half a novel each week this course is not for  you. The lectures had some interesting comical notes and some very boring ones as well.   Niall is very well-spoken nonetheless

At first, I didn't like the way his lectures were structured but after getting used to him (I was in his tutorial) and his lectures, he turned out to be a pretty alright prof and guy all-around. He is sarcastic, which is hilarious and very knowledgeable. Marks very fairly and gives good feedback. He gives you a lot of help if you ask. Recommend :)

We had to read 5 novels for this class..which was really difficult to handle so I suggest you don't take any other reading/writing intensive courses with ENGL 101. Overall it was a great class. He has a unique sense of humor and makes great insights and connections. No real complaint about him except he seems to be secretly laughing at everyone...

A bit of an arrogant guy, but very well-spoken nonetheless. Niall is real smart, but I have a problem with his lack of organization. There's very little structure to his lectures, he rarely starts class on time, and he compensates by ending class late. His rambling does get tiring and boring after a while, so be prepared.

Great prof with hilarious jokes that keep students engaged. Gives fair assignments, fair grades and tons of feedback. Creates a textbook for each student. Hard-working and brilliant. Makes interesting connections and is very clear. A+

One of the best professors I have had!  Very informative, awesome sense of humor, and the class flies by!  I also think he is a very fair marker, you get what you put in!  He is also very fair when it comes to deadlines, if he feels has not given sufficient time for an assignment, he will give more time.  Would take a class with him again for sure!

Niall was an awesome prof. Very quirky... I loved his sneakers and blazer combo. Interesting and you should really go to his lectures.... and pay attention. That's a guy you'll actually learn something from.
Very boring class. He will put you to sleep. I have had much more interesting english teachers in highschool. Quite a bit of reading.
This prof is amazing!  He chose such interesting books, led amazing discussion, and made some genius connections.  I cannot wait until he teaches another class I can take.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Interesting guy. I would definitely take a class with him again.

Genius prof.  Manages to tie material into other more significant literature and introduces some useful ideas for Arts students.  He's got an amazing sense of humour and is very knowledgeable... However, if you feel he's laughing at you secretly, he probably is..
Dry, sleep inducing, and pretentious.

Horrible teaching skill. The professor is unable to engage the student's interest and makes the class extremely boring and dry. And on top of that, you get his boring and arrogant attitude. Does not really help with papers and assignments. Very hard marker. I would advise to stay away from taking this professor's class.
Dry lectures, heavy reading, hard marking, and confusing final exam.

The lectures got a little boring (especially early in the morning) and the vast majority of material covered was not related to the final exam. The TA's marking was hard but if you read the books you'll do okay. I HIGHLY suggest taking introductory to university writing first !!

Amazing professor. Intelligent, witty, easy-going. Keeping up with reading is easy just don't be lazy. I loved this course and would absolute recommend it and any class of his. The ideal English prof. If you love English the exam/course is easy but you still learn a ton. I can't say enough good things about this prof and course.
Do not take this course!!! The TA's are extremely hard markers. The Final is hard. Do not take unless required.... Also a lot of reading.

Great Cities course- Brooklyn. I didn't mind Niall and he seems like a pretty decent guy- definitely intelligent, well spoken and wry. Had a hard time sticking through four hours of lecture though, very little discussion. A book every two weeks or so.

Seems like an interesting and friendly guy but he is an extremely hard marker and barely gives any useful feedback on papers. There's also a ton of reading involved for each class. Would not recommend.

great prof, I recommend. Very passionate and knowledgeable. Keep up with readings if you want good marks. Had to read 5 books for the course, not bad, but manageable. Go to his office hours, he's pretty cool, gives lots of information in lectures. If you like English or humanities, Niall is your man!

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Ridiculous amount of readings. Must read one book per week(300-400 pages). 5 books to read in total. Poor communication of whats to be expected on the papers, tough marker, provides no power point slides, no lecture recordings. Absolutely useless. If you can, avoid taking the class with this professor.

Great prof, good class. I only attended about half the lectures but still got a good mark. He's very helpful if you attend his office hours, but watch out - he'll probably make fun of you without you realizing it :P I'd reccomend him to anyone though. He's also pretty funny.
Great fun, fair marker, incredible resource, and the nicest guy. Cannot say enough. Take a class, if only see what this fuss about the socks is all about. Won't disappoint.

Best ever. VERY dry sense of humor - you have to pay close attention or you'll think he's serious when he's really making fun of you to amuse himself. Gives excellent feedback on papers and is especially good in tutorials. Also, awesome socks.

I found him to be a good prof! A lot of people in my class weren't happy but I enjoyed his style of teaching (a lot of lecture, not much discussion). There's some pop quizzes but the answers are quite obvious even if you didn't do all the reading. Tutorials work into exams so it's important to go. Very enjoyable class!
AWESOME

Thoroughly fantastic. Not the easiest, but very helpful and without a hint of arrogance. You will feel that you've gained something useful, and you?ll have had a blast in the meantime. Do take a class with this professor if you have the chance. Yeah, and it's true about the socks.
More effective in seminar style classes. Awesome prof!

Always has coffee in hand and may I add that he wears awesome socks! Good class to take... a bit dry though and you need to pay attention, but essay topics are easy, fair marking, and if you also have him as a TA, you'll enjoy it so much more. Overall, good class. Final exams he hands out the questions, so final was pretty much a breeze.
Likes to talk a lot! He has a dry sense of humour but his exams are straightforward and his marking fair even ranging into easy.

Niall is awesome! Essay topics and required readings were good but a little on the easy side for people who are into the subject. Generated great class discussion and is a super nice, down to earth guy. He brought our tutorial breakfast one day as an apology for giving us back our graded papers late :)

Probably one of my favourite professors. Incredibly intelligent & can appear a little intimidating but is incredibly approachable, he really wants to see his students succeed. Classes are always enjoyable, you're so busy laughing & enjoying yourself you don't realize how much information you've obtained through his unique method. Just brilliant. A+

Niall is a rather fantastic professor - amazing sense of humour and an ability to siphon knowledge into your cranium while all you are aware of is that you are having an awesome time. And yes, this man wears Great Socks.
Really boring class. Lots of writing but the marking wasnt too bad. Overall not interesting at all and would not recommend
